Candidates include NXP, Texas Instruments, and Renesas. New to the club is Ambarella, Inc., a Santa Clara, California-based developer of high-resolution video processing and computer vision chips. Ambarella revealed this week a collaboration with HELLA Aglaia, a tier-two developer focused on computer vision software for the automotive market. HELLA Aglaia is a full subsidiary of HELLA, a German tier one based in Lippstadt.
